EngineeringPhilosophy.title: Engineering Philosophy
EngineeringPhilosophy.subtitle: Engineering with empathy, kindness, and thoughtful automation—because building software isn't just about shipping features, it's about uplifting the people who create them.
EngineeringPhilosophy.radicalEmpathyDescription: I share openly to foster trust; people feel safe asking questions, raising concerns, and collaborating deeply.
EngineeringPhilosophy.developerExperienceDescription: Efficient tools and smooth workflows prevent wasted time, boost morale, and free engineers to focus on impact.
EngineeringPhilosophy.ownershipWithGenerosityDescription: When something breaks, we fix it together—no finger-pointing. Sharing credit and lessons learned empowers the entire team.
EngineeringPhilosophy.technicalForesightDescription: Thoughtful guardrails and flexible design enable growth without burying ourselves in tomorrow’s tech debt.
EngineeringPhilosophy.relentlessAutomationDescription: Automate repetitive tasks and enforce standards in CI/CD pipelines—let machines do the boring stuff, so humans can innovate.
EngineeringPhilosophy.transparentCommunicationDescription: Frequent, open updates keep everyone aligned. More clarity early on prevents unnecessary fire drills down the line.
EngineeringPhilosophy.mentorshipDescription: A mentor’s success lies in watching others thrive. Empower peers to speak up, challenge you, and own their craft.
EngineeringPhilosophy.kindnessDescription: Offer friendly feedback, not criticism. Code reviews are about collective growth, not personal attacks.

Experience.title: Work Experience
Experience.subtitle: Professional journey and career progression across leading technology companies.

Experience.item1Highlight2: Created a media upload algorithm that increased the single upload size limit from 200 MB to 15 GB. Speed was also improved by chunking and uploading files directly to Azure Blob Storage. This enabled users to upload the most media items per day in company history.
Experience.item1Highlight3: Implemented numerous features to enhance the user experience of multiple account types and roles within our multi-tenant SaaS between both our React web app and our React Native mobile application.
Experience.item1Highlight4: Created Opendorse's first private npm repository to share reusable components and utilities across multiple projects.
Experience.item1Highlight5: Mentored and pair programmed with engineers to help expand both domain knowledge and best practices.
Experience.item1Highlight6: Served as the team captain to my product team. Extra responsibilities included: regularly meeting with product and design to review technical feasibility of new features, setting the pace and standard for the rest of the team, and tasking out epics to ensure stories are ready for backlog refinement.
Experience.item1Promotion1Highlight: Led larger technical initiatives, drove technical direction, stood up business critical systems in record times.
Experience.item1Promotion2Highlight: Led technical initiatives, drove technical direction, and stood up business critical systems.
Experience.item2Highlight1: Operated as a member of the Asset Protection and Shared Services team which utilized a combination of Kanban and Scrum methodologies. The technology stack for new applications consisted of JavaScript, React, Material UI, Redux, Nodejs, Express, Java, Spring, Mongo, and Postgres.
Experience.item2Highlight2: Collaborated with our Scrum Master, Product Manager, Solutions Manager, and stakeholders to deliver value every sprint.
Experience.item2Highlight3: Worked with our business partners and vendors to integrate SAAS solutions with Lowe's environment while adhering to change management policies.
Experience.item2Highlight4: Lead team effort in identifying areas of improvement for management, set yearly action items, and organized monthly meetings with leadership to track progress and gather feedback.
Experience.item2Highlight5: Thoroughly documented applications and systems to allow non-application SME's to perform SOP's and to onboard new engineers to the applications in a more efficient manner.
Experience.item2Highlight6: Pessimistically tested new features through a combination of Behavior-Driven Development and Test-Driven Development. Frameworks used to test applications included Cypress, Jest, Mocha, Enzyme, JUnit, Mockito, and Cucumber.

PreferredTechStack.title: Preferred Tech Stack
PreferredTechStack.subtitle: Technologies I've worked with and prefer to use in my projects.
PreferredTechStack.reactDescription: I've used both vanilla and Angular. I enjoy the opinionation of Angular, but I like React allows the option to be opinionated or not.
PreferredTechStack.nextjsDescription: Next.js is just a great tool with so many out of the box features. Vercel is a nice to have as well.
PreferredTechStack.nestjsDescription: I have used Express, Java/Spring, and C#/Dotnet. There's so much value in using the same language across the stack, and NestJS really bridges the IOC gap that other languages provide.
PreferredTechStack.typescriptDescription: I think I'd be hardpressed to find someone that's used TypeScript, but prefers JavaScript. It has it's flaws but it much better than weakly typing with JSDoc.
PreferredTechStack.ormDescription: There's a place for ORMs vs sprocs, but I think ORMs are the way to go for most applications. I enjoy the startup life of building features quickly, not so much the shave x ms off this endpoint to save compute life. I can do both, but I'm happiest with the former.
PreferredTechStack.cloudDescription: I've worked with AWS, Azure, and GCP. Each has their own quirks. What I don't enjoy working with is on-prem. I like the idea and makes sense at scale, but the developer experience of on-prem is often far below that of cloud.
